keyword: calories in a soft serve ice cream
title: Calories in a Soft Serve Ice Cream
meta_description: Learn calories in a soft serve ice cream serving, plus carbs, fat, protein, full nutrition facts, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in a Soft Serve Ice Cream
assumptions: Vanilla flavor, standard machine-dispensed soft serve; one small serving (~100 g), no cone, toppings, or mix-ins.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, flavor, fat content, serving size, and machine settings. Check labels or sources when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 100 g serving of soft serve ice cream contains about 200 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a soft serve ice cream serving?
faqs.a: About 200 kcal for a 100 g vanilla serving.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in soft serve ice cream?
faqs.a: Around 24 g carbs per 100 g, mostly from sugars.

faqs.q: Is soft serve ice cream high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 11 g total fat per 100 g, with 6.8 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does soft serve compare to regular ice cream?
faqs.a: Soft serve often has similar calories but more air, making it lighter in texture.

faqs.q: Does flavor affect calories in soft serve ice cream?
faqs.a: Slightlyâ€”chocolate or fruit flavors may add 10-20 kcal per serving from cocoa or puree.
